conversation.content:
You are a new resident of the Tampa Bay area in Florida, and you've heard about this big Gasparilla pirate festival that takes place there every year.  You want to go to the main event, the invasion and day parade of pirates held at the end of January, but you're not sure of how to get there and where to park, since you've also heard that a lot of the streets are closed for the parade and parking is only in certain areas.  

You do your research and find that you really want to be at the convention center for part of the day so that you can see the boat parade approach, leading the pirate ship and the invasion, then you want to make your way to Curtis Hixon Park to see the land parade and then stay for the concerts and other festivities.  

You decide to park in a parking garage in on 8th street and Nuccio in Ybor City, then take the trolley to the convention center.  The closest trolley stop is 2 blocks away. 

From the Convention Center, Curtis Hixon Park is about a mile North. You can take the trolley most of the way between the two, but you'll still need to walk about .25 miles. The trolley runs every ten minutes, but you still may have to wait for several passes, given the size of the crowd and the demand on parade day.

You parked about 2 miles East of Curtis Hixon.  The trolley runs round trips, but the closest stop is still about .25 miles south of Curtix Hixon. 

The boat invasion takes place around noon, arriving at the Convention Center. The land parade route itself is 4.5 miles long, starts at 2 pm and ends when it reaches Curtis Hixon Park, around 2:30.

I'm going to Gasparilla! If I plan on being at the Convention Center before the boat invasion arrives, and it takes the trolley ten minutes to get from my parking garage choice and the Convention Center stop, what is the latest time I can catch the trolley and still be present for the arrival of the boat parade?

conversation.chosen:
If the trolley ride from your parking garage to the Convention Center takes ten minutes and the boat parade arrives at the Convention Center at noon, you will want to be at the trolley stop no later than 11:40 a.m. This will give you enough time to ride the trolley to the Convention Center and arrive before the parade's arrival. It's recommended to give yourself an extra ten minutes in case there's a crowd and the ride takes longer than expected. 

Be sure to check a map of the trolley routes and stops to confirm that this is the best route for you. Have a great time at Gasparilla!
conversation.rejected:

The last trolley that could get you to the Convention Center in time to see the boat parade arrive would have to leave the parking garage ten minutes before noon. 
In reality, you should plan on adding additional time to your travel in case of crowds or other unforeseen circumstances. A general rule of thumb is to add 15 minutes to the time it takes to make your trip. So, you should aim to have the trolley leave the parking garage by 11:45 am at the latest in order to arrive at the Convention Center for the boat parade's 12:00 noon arrival.

Taxis: You can hail a taxi on the street or call for one to pick you up. This can be a convenient option, but it may be more expensive than the trolley or walking.
